info.description: A Connector for TOPdesk, which entails connectors for Supporting Files, and Incident Management. All endpoint for creating, processing and closing incidents are available in the connector, aswell as alle endpoints for creating and handling branches, locations, persons and operators.
info.title: Topdesk

get.summary: Returns a list of incidents
get.description:
With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident; Category/Branch/Operator filters apply  |
| Person   |  Accessible; Person visibility settings apply |

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: The offset to start at. The default is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many incidents should be returned max. Default is 10.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order of the returned incidents. Incidents can be ordered by most of the fields. But for best performance one should order by one of the following fields: callDate, creationDate, modificationDate, targetDate, closedDate or id. It's faster to order by 1 field only. To specify if the order should be ascending or descending,append ":asc" or ":desc" to the field name. Multiple columns can be specified by comma-joining the orderings. Example: sort=tragetDate:asc,creationDate:desc. Fields not allowed for sorting are: externalLinks, escalationStatus, action, attachments, partialIncidents, partialIncidents.link

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A FIQL string to select which incidents should be returned. (See [Tutorial](https://developers.topdesk.com/tutorial.html#query))

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of which fields should be returned. By default all fields will be returned. (slow)

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description: Format of date fields in json. When set to iso8601 dates will be sent in the form of '2020-10-01T14:10:00Z'. Otherwise old date format will be used: '2020-10-01T14:10:00.000+0000'

206.description: Success, but there are more incidents

x-next-page-url.description: A link that returns the next list of incidents

400.description:
_Bad Request_
    The parameters of the request were malformed

403.description:
_Forbidden_
    No permission to access the data

404.description:
_Not Found_
    incident or attachment doesn't exist

post.description:
Operator | With create permission on 1st/2nd line incident, partials require 2nd line create permission | | Person | Can only create first line incidents for himself. Only the following fields can be set depending on the setting for the new call form:
  • request
  • briefDescription
  • callType
  • category
  • subcategory
  • object
  • request
  • location
  • operatorGroup
|

parameters.name: id

200.description:
Success
Fields exclusively for SLM-license:
* Responded
* Response date
* sla (as object) containing:
  * Response target date
  * (SLA) Target date

400.description:

get.summary: Get list of time registrations. By default only time registartions entries for 1st and 2nd line incidents are returned

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: The offset to start at. The default is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many entries should be returned max. Default is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the returned entries. To specify if the order should be ascending or descending
append ":asc" or ":desc" to the field name. Multiple columns can be specified by comma-joining the
orderings. Example: sort=timeSpent:asc,creationDate:desc. By default entries are sorted by modificationDate:desc, creationDate:desc

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A FIQL string to select which incidents should be returned.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of which fields should be returned. By default only id will be returned. The name of fields corresponds to the names
returned in response.

get.summary: Get list of SLA services
get.description:
| Permission | Remark |
|---------|-----------|
| Operator | With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident |
| Person | No access |

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The amount of SLA services to be returned per request. There is no way to request later 'pages', provide more specific filter parameters instead.

parameters.name: incident
parameters.description: An incident number or identifier. If specified, all other filter parameters are ignored, and exactly those SLA services that could apply to the incident will be returned. This filter accounts for the strict/loose validity setting, and contract start and end date.

parameters.name: contract
parameters.description: Return only SLA services for the specified contract id. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the contract (including 'person') are ignored.

parameters.name: person
parameters.description: Shortcut for filtering contract. The values from the person card are used for the contract filtering options. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the contract (except contractDate) are ignored.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: A service name or id. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the service are ignored.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branch. The Contract for head branch valid for subsidiary branches' setting is applied.

parameters.name: budgetHolder
parameters.description: Name or id of a budget holder. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified budget holder.

parameters.name: department
parameters.description: Name or id of a department. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified department.

parameters.name: branchExtraA
parameters.description: Name or id of a branchExtraA. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branchExtraA.

parameters.name: branchExtraB
parameters.description: Name or id of a branchExtraB. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branchExtraB.

parameters.name: contractDate
parameters.description: Date on which the contract needs to be valid. If not specified, defaults to now. The date must be specified in UTC, according to ISO 8601.

parameters.name: callType
parameters.description: Name or id of a call type. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified call type.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Name (default language only) or id of a category for incidents. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified category.

parameters.name: subcategory
parameters.description: Name (default language only) or id of a subcategory for incidents. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified subcategory.

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: Name, object id or asset id. Return only SLA services where the service is linked to the specified asset.

200.description: Up to _page_size_ entities have been found

206.description: More than _page_size_ entities have been found, but only so many are returned

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The parameters of the request were malformed

403.description:
_Forbidden_
  • No permission to access the data

get.summary: Get list of operator groups
get.description:
| Permission | Remarks |
| --- | --- |
| Operator | With read permission on operator groups; Branch/Operator filters apply, but operator groups that the operator is member of are not filtered |
| Person | No access |

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset at which to start listing the operator groups at. Must be greater or equal to `0`, default is `0`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The amount of operator groups to be returned per request. Must be between `1` and `100`, default is `10`.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
A FIQL search expression to filter the result. The query parameters from earlier versions still work, but if this parameter is provided, all other filter parameters are ignored. The FIQL query syntax is documented in the tutorial.

The fields available for filtering are:
  • All top-level fields in the returned object, except for preset
  • branch.id, branch.name
  • location.id, location.name
  • budgetHolder.id, budgetHolder.name
  • creator.id, creator.name
  • modifier.id, modifier.name
  • optionalFields1, optionalFields2: All subfields, including id and name for searchlists
  • externalLink.id, externalLink.type, externalLink.date
For example, if you would like to get all unarchived operator groups that have the 'stockManager' task, and a name starting with 'IT', you could use stockManager==true;archived==false;name=sw=IT.

200.description: The list of operator groups when up to `page_size` entities have been found. Within the contact field, the values of the department, telephone, faxNumber and email fields are set according to the operator group, not according to the contact operator.

parameters.description:
A FIQL search expression to filter the result. The query parameters from earlier versions still work, but if this parameter is provided, all other filter parameters are ignored. The FIQL query syntax is documented in the tutorial.

  • externalLink.id, externalLink.type, externalLink.date
For example, if you would like to get all unarchived operators that have the 'stockManager' task or are in a group that has that task, you could use (stockManager==true,operatorGroup.stockManager==true);archived==false.

Example: * `The given location doesn't belong to the given branch.` * The field `showSubsidiaries` is set to true when `showBranch` is set to false
Example: * `The field 'showSubsidiaries' can not be true when 'showBranch' is false.` * The field `authorizeSubsidiaryBranches` is set to true when `authorizeBranch` is false
Example: * `The field 'authorizeSubsidiaryBranches' can no be true when 'authorizeBranch' is false.` * Authorization checkboxes may only be set if the person is a manager
Example: * `Authorization checkboxes may only be set if the person is a manager.` * The request contains a login name without a password or a password without a login name * Login name and password must both be provided together * More examples: * `The given login name already exists but it must be unique.` * `Login name must be set and at least 1 character long.` * `Password must be at least 5 characters long and can not only contain whitespaces.` * `No password was provided, but passwords are set to be mandatory.` * `Mandatory field 'surName' is missing.` * `Can not set a person as manager who is not a manager.` * `Can not set department from an id if the setting for departments is plain text.` * `Can not set department from plain text if the setting for departments is drop-down list.` * `The new operator has login permission, but mandatory login credentials are missing.` * `Branch is a mandatory field and can't be set to null.` * `Surname is a mandatory field and can't be set to null or empty string.`

CallerCreate.description:
```
Using the caller parameter to fill in a registered caller is deprecated, use the callerLookup parameter instead.
```
The caller contact details for this incident.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Is filled in automatically for persons and when the callerLookup parameter is provided.
To fill in an unregistered caller, fill in the caller's name:

It is an error to provide both a name and a registered caller.

timeSpent.description:
Time spent in minutes. Can be negative as long as the total registered time on the incident does not go
below 0. Can not be 0.
Example: `"timeSpent": 30`

notes.description:
Notes for the entry of registered time spent
Example: `"notes": "Took a bit longer to find a patch than expected."`

entryDate.description:
Date for when the time spent should be registered. If not set, will be set to the current time.
Example: `"entryDate": : "2015-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"`
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed.
E.g. 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

callerLookup.description:
Lookup value for filling in a registered caller's contact details.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
The caller is filled in automatically for persons.
Examples:
```
"callerLookup" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"callerLookup" : { "email" : "email@domain.com" }
```
It is an error to provide more than one lookup value or to provide an empty callerLookup object.

request.description:

  • <b>

  • <br>
  • <p>
  • <div>

Example:
```
"callType" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"callType" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

category.description:

subcategory.description:
Subcategory by id or name.
Can be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.
Can be set by persons only when the appropriate setting for the new call form is checked.
It is an error to provide both an id and a name. If a subcategory is provided without a category, the corresponding category will be filled in automatically, unless there are multiple matching categories, in which case the request will fail.
Examples:
```
"subcategory" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"subcategory" : { "name" : "Printer" }
```

externalNumber.description:
External number.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.

object.description:
Object by id or by name.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Examples:
```
"object" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"object" : { "name" : "OBJ001" }
```
If both object and location are given, object is set and location is ignored.

location.description:
Location by id.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Example:
```
"location" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

branch.description:
Branch (for Location) by id.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Example:
```
"branch" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

mainIncident.description:
Main incident id or number, required for creating a partial incident.
This must be an open, unarchived second line incident and visible to the operator.
It is an error to provide a main incident for non-partial incidents.
Can only be set by operators.
example:
```
"mainIncident" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
or
````
"mainIncident" : { "number" : "I 1909 123" }
```

impact.description:
Impact by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Example:

"impact" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or

"impact" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }

```

priority.description:
Priority by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Will be automatically filled in if you provide impact and/or urgency leading to a unique priority according to your priority matrix, and the same request doesn't provide a priority. For incidents with a linked SLA, if the priority provided cannot be found in the Service Level Priority List, the duration field of the incident will be emptied.
Example:
```
"priority" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"priority" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

SLM-licence is needed.

responseDate.description:

SLM-licence is needed.
Can only be set by operators.

```

Can only be set by operators.
Example: "completedDate" : "2018-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"

closed.description:

Can only be set by operators.

closedDate.description:

Can only be set by operators.

externalNumber.description:
External number.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.

object.description:
Object by id or by name.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Examples:
```
"object" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"object" : { "name" : "OBJ001" }
```
If both object and location are given, object is set and location is ignored.

location.description:
Location by id.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Example:
```
"location" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

branch.description:
Branch (for Location) by id.
Can only be set by operators.
For partial incidents, this field is determined by the main incident and will give an error if provided in the request.
Example:
```
"branch" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

impact.description:
Impact by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Example:
```
"impact" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"impact" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

urgency.description:
Urgency by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Example:
```
"urgency" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"urgency" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

priority.description:
Priority by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Will be automatically filled in if you provide impact and/or urgency leading to a unique priority according to your priority matrix, and the same request doesn't provide a priority. For incidents with a linked SLA, if the priority provided cannot be found in the Service Level Priority List, the duration field of the incident will be emptied.
Example:
```
"priority" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"priority" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

duration.description:
Duration by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"duration" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"duration" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

targetDate.description:
Target date.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"targetDate" : "2015-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"
```
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed. E.g. 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

sla.description:
SLA by id.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"sla" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

onHold.description:
On hold. On hold date will be filled accordingly.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"onHold" : "true"
```

operator.description:
Operator by id.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.
Example:
```
"operator": { "id": "<UUID>" }
```

operatorGrpoup.description:
Operator group by id.
Can be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.
Can be set by persons only when the appropriate setting for the new call form is checked.
Example:
```
"operatorGroup" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

supplier.description:
Supplier by id.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"supplier" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```

processingStatus.description:
Processing status by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"processingStatus" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"processingStatus" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

responded.description:
Whether the incident is responded.
SLM-licence is needed.
Can only be set by operators. When the setting "Status determines responded" is on, this will be filled automatically (manual setting is prohibited).

responseDate.description:
Response date.
SLM-licence is needed.
Can only be set by operators.
Will automatically be set to current date if left out and "responded : true" is set.
Example:
```
"responseDate" : "2015-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"
```
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed. E.g. 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

completed.description:
Whether the incident is completed.
Can only be set by operators.

completedDate.description:
Completed date.
Can only be set by operators.
Example: "completedDate" : "2018-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed. E.g. 2018-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2018-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

closed.description:
Whether the incident is closed.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, will be ignored. The value of completed will be used instead.

closedDate.description:
Closed date.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, will be ignored. The value of completedDate will be used instead.
Example: "closedDate" : "2018-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed. E.g. 2018-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2018-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

closureCode.description:
Closure code by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"closureCode" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"closureCode" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

costs.description:
Costs.
Can only be set by operators.
Example: "costs" : "0.15"

feedbackRating.description:
Rate incident, only available for closed incidents.
Can only be set by operators or the caller of the incident.
Example:
```
"feedbackRating" : "5"
```

feedbackMessage.description:
Leave feedback message on incident, only available for closed incidents and when feedbackRating is given.
Can only be set by operators or the caller of the incident.
Example:
```
"feedbackMessage" : "Nice!"
```

majorCall.description:
Whether the incident is a major call.
Can only be set by operators.

majorCallObject.description:
Major call by id or number.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"majorCallObject" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"majorCallObject" : { "name" : "I 1909 123" }
```

publishToSsd.description: Whether the incident should be published in the Self Service Desk; only major incidents can be published. Can only be set by operators.
